docs.text: Introduction Markdown is one of the famous markup languages widely used by developers, bloggers, messaging services etc. Due to its dead-easy syntax and possiblity to implement multiple plugins like mermaid , recently it gained much attention in the academic writing. Markdown syntax is not standarized universaly. So, depending upon the platform, the syntax may slightly vary - and could have additional features. One good example is capability of using latex symbols and math functions inside markdown supported by R markdown and Github flavoured markdown syntaxes. There were multitude of cheatsheets and tutorials available on markdown. But this guide focus more on their applicability towards scientific writing. The guide is configured as follows: Basic Syntax Rendring output Standard tools Other tweaks
